metadata.title: CVE-2016-8405 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An information disclosure vulnerability in kernel components including theION subsystem, Binder, USB driver and networking subsystem could enable alocal malicious application to access data outside of its permissionlevels. This issue is rated as Moderate because it first requirescompromising a privileged process. Product: Android. Versions: Kernel-3.10,Kernel-3.18. Android ID: A-31651010.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8405` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-67-generic - 4.4.0-67.88
linux-image-4.4.0-67-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-67.88
linux-image-4.4.0-67-lowlatency - 4.4.0-67.88
linux-image-4.4.0-67-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-67.88
linux-image-4.4.0-67-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-67.88
linux-image-4.4.0-67-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-67.88
linux-image-4.4.0-67-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-67.88
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-67-generic - 4.4.0-67.88
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1048-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1048.55
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-67.88').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
